title: The Inner Circle
description: Tensions rise and feelings are hurt when Deangelo creates an "inner circle" at the office--which is only composed of men.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: So, coasting time is officially over.  Big changes are comin', and they're comin' fast.  If you don't like 'em, this is called a door.  You can walk right through it.  Alright.  I'm not here to be your friend.  I like my life outside of this place.  I live to leave at 5.  Change number one:

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: They are trying to figure me out.  And I don't like it.  Once they figure me out, they start to tell me what I want to hear.  And I need to quickly figure out who's a good worker and who is simply a good mind reader.  Because as soon as I'm hearing what I want to hear, I'm not gonna care.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Change two, Toby, you're gettin' a new chair.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Don't thank me!  Hey, don't thank me, guy!  Okay?  And I don't care if you like it.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: These sound like good ideas, why wouldn't we like them?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: I don't care what your favorite flavor is.  Here's a bowl of ice cream.  You either like it or you don't.  [Andy nods] That's my attitude right now in this room, that's my attitude on Ice Cream Thursdays.  Alright?  Clear?  Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This all sounds great to me.  [hesitates] But I could see how some people might think that they're bad.  I don't know what to think.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: That is a s-  astute observation, Kevin.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Kev's got me pegged.  [chuckles]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: It blows away Vermont in the fall.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Snap, for real?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Good morning, Deangelo.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Hold on.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [continuing to talk to Darryl] And if you're really serious, you should go in the spring.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because of the flowers.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No.  Because the entire state smells like Earth.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Dogwoods, or just the Earth.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey, well, good morning.  I think I have good news for you today.  I found your new executive assistant.  My friend Carla.  [looking at resume]  She's got great experience.  We even considered making her Cece's godmother, but she had this boyfriend at the time- but here's her resume.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Put it with the rest.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [entering his office] Hey dudes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh my God, he hates me!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No he doesn't.  You just get so nervous and hyper around him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Every time there's a silence, your brain's like "Heh-heh-huh-huh" [imitating crying].

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Is that what he tells you at your little inner circle meetings?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Careful.  There is no inner circle.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, there's an inner circle.  Oh yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: There is no inner circle.  Deangelo just prefers to delegate a few things, to a few guys.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Jim only says that because he's in the inner circle.  I also say that because I am also in the inner circle.  Did you get that, Ma?  Your boy, Kevin Malone, is IN the inner circle!  [thinks] Which doesn't exist.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [holding two cups of coffee] There he is!  Got ya coffee.  [offers cup to Dwight]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, wow, thank you.  That was so kind of you.  [throws cup in the garbage]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Not a coffee guy, I take it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's just that I own the coffee shop.  So, once you've seen sausage being made, all you want to do is make sausage, because it's so much fun.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Listen.  I've got a sixer.  "Automatic for the People" on the jukebox.  Let's hit the park after sundown.  Come on!  Pick up some sausage if you want.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I think you'll find what you're looking for [points toward Oscar] over there.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No matter how many times I reach out to Dwight, he doesn't seem to want anything to do with me.  It reminds me of my relationship with my son.  Except there, I'm the Dwight.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Who's the biggest client in the state?  I say we go get 'em, whatever it takes.  Huh?  What do you guys say?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Right!  Or my other idea, 50,000 tiny clients.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I say we just go for it!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [shoots mini basketball at hoop on office door, misses badly] Is that ball lighter than usual?  Is that a Chinatown knockoff?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's Toys R Us, I think.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No, that's definitely a knockoff.  You can feel the center of gravity's off.  Feel that.  [throws ball to Gabe]  What do you think?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [holding ball in open palm] Oh, yeah, totally.  Jim, you got ripped off big time.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [calling for the ball] Deangelo! [shoots and makes it]  See what I did there?  That's what you need to do.  [makes shooting gesture] It's that little English.  The British are coming.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Deangelo's open!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Hey Ry.  Your department's killing it, baby. [puts arm around Ryan]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey hey, my pleasure, my treasure.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Keep it up.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: The problem with having "It" or "the X-factor" or whatever it is you want to call it, is that it's impossible to put into words what you're bringing to the table.  So to make things simpler for Deangelo, I just, without lying, strongly implied that I'm Kelly's supervisor.  It's not even that much of a stretch.  She pretty much does whatever I say.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry, I'm sorry...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Why should I pretend that you are my boss?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Because what would you have done in that situation, Kelly?  I'll tell you what I would have done for you.  I'd lie for you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah, but you lie all the time.  You lie for no reason.  Ryan, you just like to lie.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I'd die for you too.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You really would?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [hears Deangelo entering] Hey, Kelly Kapoor, if I don't have those call logs on my desk, we're just gonna have to evaluate your future at the company!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Sure thing, Mr. Howard.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Woo.  Glad he's not my boss.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [whispers to Kelly]  You're the best.  Thank you.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: You know I have a cousin who cracked the secret formula for a certain popular cola that I shall not name.  So I've never had to buy it.  True story.  I just drink my cousin's.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Congratulations on your one cousin.  I have seventy.  Each one better than the last.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: You know what... straight up, why don't you like me?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm just not a suck-up like everyone else around here.  Okay?  I do my job well, so why don't you just leave me alone and let me do it.  Okay?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Ohhhh no.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Okay?  I'm gonna win you over.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No you're not.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes I am.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Oh yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yes.  Yes-yes-yes-yes-yes [starts to run out of the break room] yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes-yes!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [looking at resume] Uh oh, this former administrative assistant misspelled "administrative" and "assistant."

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The winner:

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Sorry gang.  Thought my juggling stuff was in the trunk of my car.  It's not.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh no, do you think it was stolen?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I gotcha covered, boss.  Used to play with the parabolas myself. [opens desk drawer and takes out balls]  Got some extra balls!  [throws them toward Deangelo, who dodges them]  Hey-hey-hey-ho!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Sorry, I never touch another juggler's instruments.  You know, we're all here, I've got the music cued, why don't I just do my routine without the juggling balls? [starts to play "Wake Me Up Inside" by Evanescence] Prepare... to go into the danger zone.  [begins pretend juggling routine]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh wow, you weren't kidding.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No.  Never.  Can someone please throw me a fifth ball?  If you dare!  [Kevin pretends to throw ball]  Incoming!  And we're on!  Remember, nothing's impossible!  Phyllis, where's Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: [raises hand] Here.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Do you believe in me, Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Because I believe in you.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [pretending to bounce balls off Phyllis at close range]  Feel that connection?  Don't move your head.  Please.  Thank you.  Oh!  Big hand for Phyllis!  [clapping]  That took a lot of guts!  [finishes routine]  Ho!  I'm Deangelo Vickers, thank you so much, hope you learned something.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Didn't drop a single ball!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [imitating Deangelo's pretend juggling routine] Look.  I'm juggling eggs and bowling balls.  I'm juggling with one hand.  No hands.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: What could he possibly stand to gain from a fake juggling routine?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What could he possibly stand to gain from a real juggling routine?  How can you keep defending him?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He's good at his job.  And I like working for him.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Of course you do, Jim.  You're a man.  Deangelo is a huge sexist.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa.  I think if he was sexist, I'd be able to tell.  I took a crapload of women's studies courses at Cornell.  And I wrote my own companion piece to the "Vagina Monologues" called the "Penis Apologies."  So I know a thing or two.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Okay.  Then how about I'm the head of the Accounting Department, but he only ever talks to Kevin?  What about Pam and Kelly?  Also department heads.  But has he ever met with you or even asked you to do anything?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: How could I not see it?  You're so right.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Why don't you talk to him about it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And say what?  "Hey Deangelo, are you shy or just a sexist?"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Why don't you just tell him how his actions are being perceived by the women in this office?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And if he doesn't listen, then he can kiss his penis goodbye.  Snip snip.  Am I right, girls?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, you got a second?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yeah, I got tons of time.  This job's a joke.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: So what's up?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Umm, really, it's nothing, I was just talking to Angela, and she was --

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [opening door to Deangelo's office] Hey, saw Jim come in.  We meeting?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yeah sure.  Let's make it a meeting. [Darryl, Kevin, Gabe enter office]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: If it's alright, can I just have like one minute alone, just to go over --

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: What's the big secret?  Why are you even whispering?  Come on, it's the guys!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know. [Gabe and Darryl stand on either side of Jim with paper and pens in hand]  Just the guys.  Well, maybe that's, uh, part of the problem.  I think...so what happened was, I was talking with some of the department heads.  Uh, some of the female department heads.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Uh-oh.  Right?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Hot!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Maybe there's a vibe out there, with certain members of the office, that you are...a little sexist, or --

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Damn!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Whoa.  Whoa.  Wait.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Are you serious?  Who feels this way?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh.  Like nobody.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Umm, Pam?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was --

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Was it Pam?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: That sounds like Pam.  You know how she gets.  Deangelo, she can get really bitchy.  [begins bad imitation of Pam] Kevin...

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Guys.  Hold on.  Doesn't matter who, okay?  I'm just happy that Jim brought it to my attention because honestly, I had - I had no idea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's awesome.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: [on phone] Mom, Ryan's taking us out to dinner tonight.  No, no, he's not going to stand us up like he did last time.  He won't ever stand us up again.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [joint talking head with Kelly] So I am the new customer service supervisor.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: When Deangelo's around.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And I am also a very dutiful boyfriend when --

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: All the time.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: All the time.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Erin, do you mind running down to the lobby and bringing up my brand new executive assistant?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Absolutely.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey, who'd you end up hiring?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Oh, I'm glad you asked, Jim.  Because apparently there's a rumor running around here that I am a sexist.  I can't work here effectively if you guys think I'm something that I am not.  I am not a sexist.  Raise your hand if you have a vagina.  [Deangelo raises hand, Kelly and Pam sheepishly raise hands] Raise your hand if someone you love has a vagina.  [Deangelo raises other hand, along with rest of office] Yeah, yeah.  Okay.  Just about everyone.  What about Deangelo's hand?  Oh wow.  He's got 'em both up.  [Ryan raises both hands]  Yeah.  Uh huh.  [others raise both hands] Yeah, so it bothers me when I hear that there's gossip around here that I treat women lesser than men.  Okay?  Frankly, we all look a little ridiculous when that happens.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm not a feminist, but I think that the men in this office are being given chances that the women aren't.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Dwight, what's your take?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What's the argument here?  NBA, WNBA.  One is a sport, one is a joke.  I love sports, I love jokes.  Room for all.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Man, you're smart.  [Erin arrives with new executive assistant]  Oh, hey!  Hi!  Hello.  Welcome.  Uh, everyone, I'd like you to please welcome Jordan Garfield.  This is everyone.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Hello.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, Jordan, uh, where did you work before?  Uh, a law office?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: No, Anthropology.  We don't have this in that size, pretty lame.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Lame?  You worked at Anthropology?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's like my dream job.  How did you even get that job?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Well, I umm -

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: You chose this job over that job?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay, okay, back to work, Kelly, we have a lot to get done today.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, umm, is this your first office job then?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No corporate experience whatsoever.  I didn't want anyone with any bad habits.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [heading into Deangelo's office] Jim, you coming?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh yeah, did he text us?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah. [Jim looks at cell phone as Dwight's phone vibrates]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [holds up phone and looks into Deangelo's office] No!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim, what are you doing?  Get in there.  This is not the time to take a stand.  At least he likes one of us.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He didn't text me.  [Andy's phone chimes]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes!  I'm in.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Andy, what are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm going in, into the belly of the beast.  Gonna infiltrate and change from within.  [joins the group in Deangelo's office]  What's up, mancave! [makes barking noises]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [to Jim] Just go in.  Just go in, he probably forgot to text you.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Internally, for office use [Jim quietly enters Deangelo's office and sits down] where do we get our paper from?  Do we go -

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Jordan] Don't worry, the first day's always the hardest.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [staring at Jim] Hey Jim.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Can I help you?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Nope.  Just... [Deangelo continues staring at him] Okay. [gets up and leaves office]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So, he kicked you out of the inner circle, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, there is no inner...circle.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Dwight?  Deangelo wanted me to ask you if there's anything I can help you with.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Really?  Anything.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Do you need anything?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Deangelo, tell your whore to leave me alone.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, I do not want to waste your time, so I will keep this br-r-r-r-r-r-ief.  Now, word on the street is, Mercy Hospital, back on the market.  Deangelo would like you to put together a sales pitch for next week.  Deangelo has also recently learned about the Barnacle Project.  Which is a non-profit organization based in Mystic, Connecticut that assists in the scraping of barnacles --

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: So this is my life.  Until I win the lottery [laughs].  Or Pam finally writes that series of young adult books.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So one afternoon, while walking home from school, quirky 10th grader Becky Walters finds a wounded Pegasus in the woods.  And she becomes...The Horse Flyer.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Hey!  Kelly, that's the last time I'm gonna talk to you about your paycheck!  Okay?  We pay you a fair salary here, and if you're only here for the money, maybe you shouldn't be here at all.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: No one likes a money grubber.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Howard, I apologize for grubbing for money.  I can't do this.  I can't do this.  I'm sorry.  I just can't do it.  Deangelo, Ryan is not my boss.  Okay?  Frankly, he hasn't had a real job here in years.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Oh, that's hilarious, Kelly.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: No, he's just a big fraud, Deangelo.  He's like Rango.  He doesn't work here, basically.  Just like the way Rango didn't save those animals.  It was just a big misunderstanding.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Is this true, Ryan?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: I did not see Rango.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Okay, I don't have time for this he said-she said.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: He's not saying anything!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: It's too murky.  I like Ryan.  You seem kind of hysterical to me.  Ryan's your supervisor.  Let's just leave it that way.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: That's not fair, I mean, I've been working here for such a long ti- [Deangelo walks away]

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: [sighs] Oh, close call!  Okay, why don't you just finish this up and leave it on my desk and I will see you at your place around 2 am.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [knocking on door to Deangelo's office as loud yelling comes from inside it] Hey!  It sounds like you guys are having a lot of fun, but it's really loud, and some of us are trying to work, so do you think you could do it a little more quietly?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, that's gonna be tough, because we're getting a dunking clinic from Magic Jordan himself.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [chuckles] Oh, you mean Michael Jordan?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: [laughs] Total brain burp.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: I'm no MJ.  I can do his dunk.  From the free throw line.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Daaamn!  Mad respect for my brotha!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: The man is paying me to take Chinese.  I will say what I need to say, and soon, I will say it in Chinese.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Okay, well it's just really loud.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Okay.  We'll keep that in mind.  Alright, ladies, back to the game.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Do it!

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Jim!  Come on in.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You're back in.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You know what?  Instead of a game, why don't we do an exhibition?  I'd love to see that dunk of yours.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yeah, we'll set that up one day.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Today.  Now, maybe.  'Cause we have a hoop downstairs and a real ball, so you don't have to mime it.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yeah, I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Why not?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Only because no one has called NASA to request a liftoff. [laughter] Let's go downstairs!  Okay?  Let's do it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Pass.  If I wanted to see a pissing contest, I'd lock Mose in the chicken coop.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Damn it, Dwight!  Enough!  Get your ass downstairs or find a new place to sell paper! [Dwight immediately gets up and walks out]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Okay, a little about me.  I respond to strong leadership.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Alright, there you go.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Seems a little close, you sure that's the real foul line?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: 15 feet from the baseline, so, you need me to move it in?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Nah, that's 15.  Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: And uh, you know what, to make it interesting, Jordan, why don't you sit underneath the basket?

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: Seriously?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Yeah, come on.  I'll dunk over you.  Best seat in the house.

quotes.speaker: Jordan
quotes.text: I don't, I don't think I can do that.  I'm holding your jewelry.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Right.  Yeah.  Okay, fair enough.  Kevin, you do it.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!  Okay. [sits down in front of basket]

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Someone want to sit in Kevin's lap?  Angela?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Okay, Jimmy, this is for you.  Show you that anything is possible.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Fantastic.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: Alright?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: This is also for the troops.  [backs up, bounces ball, starts running, jumps, lands in front of Kevin, jumps again, pulls himself up by the net, dunks ball, hangs on rim]  Doctor is in! [hoop starts to fall] Ahhhh! [hoop crashes down on Deangelo]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [ambulance pulls away in parking lot] Now what?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Deangelo enters office in hospital gown with bandage on his head] Deangelo?

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [speaking gibberish] Tablab.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh my God, are you alright?  Erin, will you call 911 please?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Who should I say is calling?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Erin.

quotes.speaker: DeAngelo
quotes.text: [lots of gibberish] says to bartender [lots more gibberish]  Droswip.  Droswip.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Droswip, yeah.  I get it.  Okay, we're gonna get you to the restroom.
